radiographic_examinations.findings: The hepatic parenchyma appears within normal limits. The contour of the liver is smooth. There is no focal liver mass. The main portal vein is patent with hepatopetal flow. There is no ascites. There is no intrahepatic biliary dilation. A 4.3 cm, oval, avascular heterogeneously echogenic structure is seen near the neck of the gallbladder, favored to represent sludge as opposed to a soft tissue mass. There is edema and thickening of the gallbladder wall up to 0.7 cm. Limited views of the right kidney shows no hydronephrosis.
